alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued August 31 at 10:12PM MST until August 31 at 11:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... East central La Paz County in west central Arizona... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 1115 PM MST. * At 1012 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 17 miles north of Wintersburg to near Tonopah to 13 miles southwest of Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes AZ Interstate 10 between 63 and 110. Locations impacted include... Buckeye, Tonopah, Painted Rock Dam, Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station, Wintersburg, Hassayampa, and Arlington. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
